A guide of biggest problem of $MELI B2C logistics - fulfillment by Mercado Libre or the replicate of FBA

And what $SE management team said about cost leadership in delivery cost in Shopee Brazil.

There are certain items that a centralized B2C logistics will work extremely well and being really cost effective. That's the high frequency product and the high tickets item.

The high frequency products SKU is limited can be source easily with huge volumes discounts and the high tickets items need more trust when buying it is goods for B2C platforms.

But for the long tail of SKU. FBA model doesn't work too well. There are two main reasons.

- FBA comes with huge complexity with fulfillments. A single point of warehouse space is limited, the complexity of SKU will drive up the cost dramatically.

It's extremely easy for a seller to fulfill a order with a few SKU with pure hands. But it's extremely hard for a warehouse that is multiple football field to fulfill an order even with high tech robot.

- The longer inventory turnover cycle of SKU. For the merchants that use FBA, they need to send the package to their own warehouse to check it first. Then it will be send to the $MELI warehouse. The time need to turnover the inventory will be a lot longer.

To makes matters worst for long tail products, since it's rather low frequency and hard to predict demand. Inventory management become the most important job in the business. It need a very short inventory turnover cycle to be manage the business well.

A long SKU business example is clothing. Fast fashions brand Zara or Shein always emphasis on the turnover rate of agile production of clothes to prevent loss of inventory. For the long tail SKU, the demand is not stable, the merchant doesn't know what will sell well. FBA lead time kill lots of businesses.

These logistics reasons are one of the factors that make Amazon market share on eCommerce stagnant at 40%. It's hard to become bigger. Since lots of product vertical isn't suitable for the Amazon model.
